alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 7:28AM CDT until July 11 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Cleveland, McClain and Pottawatomie. In southern Oklahoma, Carter, Garvin, Murray and Stephens. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 728 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing, especially flood prone areas. Between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen overnight. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.2 inches are possible in the warned area. The Flash Flood Warning has been replaced with a Flood Warning through 9:15 am. Please continue to heed remaining road closures. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pauls Valley, Purcell, Lindsay, Wynnewood, Lexington, Stratford, Maysville, Dibble, Elmore City, Wayne, Paoli, Wanette, Katie, Byars, Foster, Tatums, Rosedale, Antioch, Hennepin and Criner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
